result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert Zafar Valenzuela was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety of controlled substances and alcohol.  Random UA's.
Defendant may apply for expungment if law abiding & fine paid in full within 24 mos.. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Commence on or before January 2, 2015 unless agent states earlier

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Albert Zafar Valenzuela

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Albert Zafar Valenzuela not in court.  Michael X. Albrecht and intern Emma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states they are objecting to expungment and requests petition be denied.  Court notes she reviewed the statute regarding expungment.  State responds as to why they are still objecting/fines never paid so they feel probation wasn't successfully completed.  Court reviews file and states that she now agrees w/the State and the petition for expungment is denied.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Albert Zafar Valenzuela in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Martinez states matter is resolved and states recs.  Atty Martinez notes two exceptions to the agreement (absolute sobriety and expungment).  Ct 1 to be amended to simple possession as a felony w/probation.  State moves to amend Ct 1.  Court grants amendment and Atty Martinez enters NC plea.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  DE advised of felony firearms/voting/appeals rights.  State is opposed to expungment as requested by Atty Martinez and will leave the absolute sobriety issue up to the agent.  Atty Martinez responds re: these two matters.  DE makes brief statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Ct 1:  NC - as amended
Probation for 2 years
Conditions of probation:
20 days jail w/huber but w/o good time consecutive to any other sentence
To commence on or before 1/2/2015 at 7:30 pm unless agent directs otherwise
DNA sample to be provided
Costs/surcharges of $638.25 to be paid per agent during term of probation
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances
Random urinalysis per agent
Not to possess any controlled substances w/o valid prescription 
Must notify agent w/in 2 working days if a prescription is received
Not to go to any bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business that sells drug paraphernalia
Obtain/maintain full-time employment/education
Evaluation/counseling/treatment all per agent
Any other conditions per agent
DE may apply for expungment upon successful completion of probation if fines paid in full and no new law violations
DE to report to P&P no later than 3pm tomorrow 

Cts 2 and 3:  Dismissed/read-in
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 1, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Albert Zafar Valenzuela in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez would request more time to speak with ADA Newton re: the case.  Court suggests new date be obtained from Br. 2 assistant.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Albert Zafar Valenzuela in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Martinez states matter is resolved and requires probation.  DE has now moved to IL.  Wants to be sure he can transfer that probation to IL.  State believes it is transferable.  Atty Martinez wants 1 or 2 weeks to have plea/sent set to talk to P&P.  Will be a felony plea/probation case.  Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial on November 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on November 3, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
